Review.Contenu: Super Disappointed. I thought this dot.thin would be a seamless and eco-friendly way to share our organization's business cards. Instead, the majority of the phones will not scan the cards. Customer support will charge you $5 "restocking fee" to return the item, even though it doesn't work. It will work on the new phones, so they consider it not defective, but they expect you to ask each person if their NFC is turned on and make sure they do this and that in order to read your Dot. People don't want to mess with all of that. It certainly isn't as simple as tapping and going like they claim. I can't believe we are being charged this restocking fee. It's a good idea, but this isn't working.

Review.Titre: Useless Information in Contact Card and Multiple Steps to Save a Contact
Review.Contenu: The idea behind this card is great.  But unfortunately, dot pushes extraneous information to the recipient of your contact card. When your contact taps your card or scans your QR code and attempts to import your information, they also receive a URL to your dot profile.  This extra URL is shown above the URL for your business.  There is no way to prevent this URL from being sent so your recipients see both your business URL and your dot profile URL.  This causes confusion for those looking at your contact information.The return policy of the company is horrendous.  I wanted to return my cards because in my mind they are useless because they push the extra URL that is not needed.  But returning the generic card would have resulted in a restocking fee. And even though my custom cards were not yet printed, they would not let me cancel my order.  The useless cards and the terrible return policy is why they are getting a 1 star rating.I emailed back and forth with a customer service rep named James.  He was very pleasant and helped as much as he could.  He said he forwarded my request to provide the option to remove the dot profile URL from the contact card to their development team.  If this feature becomes available, I would switch my rating from 1 star to 4 stars.There is 1 additional issue that would limit them to 4 stars instead of 5 if they add the feature I mentioned above.  The additional issue is that when the recipient taps or scans, they are brought to the dot site where they must go through several clicks to save the contact.  They must click save contact, then click save contact again, then a file is downloaded and the user must click to open the file, at that point the contact card is opened and the user clicks Import.  That's a total of 4 clicks for the user after the card tap.  So it is not the simple tap and store that you see in the promotional material.

Review.Titre: *AVOID!* Once you Buy, They Spam You Endlessly!
Review.Contenu: Around mid-August 2023 they started spamming my email almost daily, and it never ended. On Black Friday alone, they sent 3 emails in the same day! I already own their product, they know that, which is why I'm on their emails to begin with. As if my business needs more spam emails! I'm trying to run a business and instead of helping they make more difficult! They turned me from a loyal fan to an ex-customer, and I've thrown the dots in the trash, and I highly recommend avoiding the scammy company at all costs.

Review.Titre: Forced word limits on all sections, no customization
Review.Contenu: I originally loved the customizeable feature of the dot profile. However, they recently “updated” the profiles and now every single section has a 35 letter limit. This is absurd. So now you can’t enter your business name, education, skills, job titles, etc without it being less than 35 letters long. They took away the whole aspect of customization. I’ll be choosing a different company that doesn’t force me to shorten my certificates or skills or other important things for my business. I reached out to their customer service and they said they’d “forward it to their development team” for consideration.

Love the idea, it has been great for face-to-face networking. However, the majority of my networking is done through phone call, and for some reason non iPhone users do not receive my Dot card when I try sending my profile via text. I've have reached out to the support team a number of times with zero follow up on their end - their communication has been subpar to say the least.

Review.Titre: The card doesn’t work when I try to…
Review.Contenu: The card doesn’t work when I try to share my info with someone’s phone. It also just randomly goes off on my own phone. No support to speak of other than frequently asked questions which isn’t helpful. Pretty disappointed in my experience so far. I planned to order these for all of our employees but I will be looking for other options.

Review.Contenu: I bought a Dot Slim for my friend as a gift. We found out later the dot slim doesn't penetrate between 1 or 2 phone cases. So, it has basically been ineffective.

I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the service and product I received from dot.card. I ordered a card from your company and activated it online, providing all the required information. However, when I tried to scan the card, it showed a different company’s name. This is unacceptable and misleading.I contacted your email support five times, but I did not receive any reply or assistance. This is very frustrating and disappointing, as email is the only support option you offer. I decided to cancel my order and request a refund, but I was shocked to learn that I had to mail the card back to you at my own expense, and pay a five dollar cancellation fee. This is unfair and unreasonable, especially since the card was defective and not as advertised.

Review.Contenu: We purchased 10 Dot Thins for our business. Unfortunately we find this product extremely diffucult to work with and the tap feature does not work on multuple devices including Iphone and Android.

And customer service is useless. I explained the issue, but no one is answering me or trying to resolve my issue. Don't lose your money.

Review.Titre: The dot classic doesn't work and your…
Review.Contenu: The dot classic doesn't work and your customer service is lacking. I reached out SEVERAL TIMES to get no help. I obviously got a bad dot and it should have been replaced immediately!
Went to a convention, and purchased my dot because I thought I it would be a great innovation, but it didn’t work once. Asked for a refund on the Instagram page but no one responded.

Review.Titre: Hidden charges / Returns = NO Customer Svc.
Review.Contenu: A card is purchased, and when registering, it wants a credit card to "activate" you yet wants $39.95 annually as well.No customer service is available, or website to facilitate a return. When returned due to scan/fraud from my bank, the shipping address in LA didn't register with UPS - apparently, Suite G doesn't exist.

Review.Titre: DO NOT BUY- Does NOT work
Review.Contenu: The cards that I received did not work. The one card that kind of worked you had to position in so many different ways before another cell phone would be able to read it. Once it was finally able to read it, you can only save the name and phone number to your contacts, all the rest of the information you share does not transfer to the contact. It only stays in the web page that is opened on the receiving cell phone and obviously that is not the purpose of sharing as you want all your business contact to transfer. I attempted to activate another of the 5 cards I bought and it would not activate and ended up just duplicating the information on the first card. Why would  I need to have the same information on a second card? I was charged $10 to return the purchase. I seriously caution anyone from buying these cards. They do not work!

Garbage.  Arrvied in the mail, cannot be set up.  Even the stupid scan doesn't work to set it up.  NO customer service.  Now, 5 months later, they respond with a general service link not relevant to my complaint at all

Don’t Waste Your Money!!I purchased the card and thin dot for the back of my phone. The card works fine but the THIN DOT DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. I contacted support and over roughly 4 back and forth emails, my request for a replacement or refund for that item to the account charged has been blatantly ignored. Their customer service sucks. Through the process they continued to say I was doing something wrong. They required a video to prove my case and when I provided it showing it didn’t work, they ignored it and tried to close the case!!!!!

I ordered a dot.thin for my iPhone 13 Pro Max and it does not reliably work. This included iPhones and I never got it to work with an Android. I tried it in my Spec case and I tried it out of the case and saw no improvement. Dot.card tech support tells you to find the “sweet spot” on the iPhone and Android, which is dumb to begin with but after giving it a try - it was still intermittent and absolutely useless with Android. BTW, Android users need to have their NFC (near-field communication) option switched on, so imagine you’re with a customer/client and you have to first start fishing for the sweet spot and then query them about whether their NFC option is on or off. Lol… not going to happen. I asked for the return/refund info and was told that because it was taken out of its packaging, that would deduct $5 from the purchase price. Then, because I didn’t immediately try everything described above to get this thing to work within 40 days, I was told that the refund was no longer available. Hilarious. Great idea and if you choose to get one I suggest you immediately try it out and if it doesn’t work, request the refund - but remember, don’t remove it from its packaging or that will cost you $5. 😂

As a Realtor, I thought this was a great idea.  I was gonna show all 400 of my office colleagues and gift them to my clients.  But the customer service sucks.  They get back to you with a canned response but never actually get back to you to help you with your problem.  I'll probably find something else with better customer service
Setting the card up even for a technology savvy person is not easy. There are so many other options for such cards - pick any other.

1 is likely too high for this operation.  It seems like a great idea - And, the idea of getting away from business cards seems to have some merit.  However, with this company, the plot thickens.  You place an order - For, something (I imagine something specific that you actually wish to purchase) - They hammer you with crazy high fees to get your items any quicker than what took me two weeks for regular postal delivery.  Fair enough so far.  They can't control postal deliver times, to an extent - But, when it takes well over a week to package items, something is off.  The items that they send don't come close to what you ordered.  If you ordered 5 orange cards - There is a high probability that you're going to receive 2 Blue Index Cards or some other random office supplies that they picked up from around the office.  In my case, I received fully HALF of the items that I actually ordered.  I reached out to "customer service" and I received a response back, via email that said - And, I quote - "We are human.  We make mistakes."  That's it!  A statement that identifies the company as being human and a reminder that humans make mistakes.  How is this helpful?  Clearly, I now wish to return what I didn't order and I'm looking for a FULL refund.  I send two more emails with nothing but canned, auto-response.  This once very human company all of a sudden cannot find a human anywhere to reply to your refund request.  Finally, it comes in - No, wait ... There's more.  Now, you have to pay for return shipping.  YOU - the customer that received less than half of what they charged you for - And, didn't receive your order - YOU have to fund the cost of sending it back and then they'll process the refund - Less their processing.  This company, far as I can tell, is simply a scam/rouse operation to charge people processing fees.  Terrible.  Terrible.  Terrible.  STAY AWAY - There is something suspiciously criminal being done here.  I've never worked with a company, or had business dealings with a company, that cared less for their customers.

I regret to express my profound disappointment with the services provided by dot.card. My experience has been marked by a series of issues that have left me utterly dissatisfied. Several aspects of their service have been particularly concerning and have significantly impacted my confidence in their offering.First and foremost, the absence of reliable customer support has been a glaring issue. Despite their claim of providing email support, I have submitted five separate inquiries that have gone unanswered. This lack of responsiveness has been frustrating and has left me feeling unheard and unsupported.Furthermore, my attempt to cancel my subscription was met with an unexpected obstacle. The response I received indicated that a refund was not guaranteed, even if I were to bear the cost of returning the card. In addition, the imposition of a $5.00 charge for returning the card is not only unexpected but also exacerbates the overall unsatisfactory experience.Attempting to voice my concerns through a negative review only led to further frustration. An email I received in response seemed automated and did not align with the issues I had outlined. The instructions provided in the email were inconsistent with the information available on the website, creating confusion and a lack of clarity.To compound these problems, using the card itself has been an exasperating experience. Instead of connecting to my intended company, the card inexplicably linked to an entirely different entity. This discrepancy raises serious questions about the reliability and accuracy of the service dot.card claims to provide.In light of these issues, I feel compelled to warn others about the shortcomings of dot.card. The lack of effective customer support, discrepancies between communication channels, and the card's failure to function as intended are all significant red flags that potential customers should be aware of.In conclusion, my interactions with dot.card have been far from satisfactory. The numerous problems I have encountered, combined with the lack of responsiveness and clarity, have led me to question the integrity and reliability of their service. I strongly advise individuals to exercise caution and consider alternative options when evaluating their card services.

Review.Titre: one Of the dot cars the nfc don't work…
Review.Contenu: one Of the dot cars the nfc don't work but other than that i love it

Shoddy product with GARBAGE customer service.I ordered both the standard Dot Card, and the Dot Thin (designed to go under your phone case). The Dot Thin successfully connected to my Dot Profile, but none of my friend's phones could successfully scan it. Additionally, the banner image I uploaded to my Dot Profile always appeared blurry/pixelated on mobile devices. Since the main purpose of the product is to bring up your profile on people's mobile devices, this is a significant issue.I emailed Dot Support about both issues.First off, I've never seen a US-based company that takes as long to reply to support requests as they do. Their average response time with me over the course of these exchanges was 4-7 days. Shameful.When it came to the pixelated banner image, their first response was in reference to the dimensions I should use. The dimensions they provided were incorrect. Using the dimensions they suggest, the top and bottom of your image will get cropped off. The profile doesn't allow for repositioning of your banner image either, so you can't even control *where* your image would be cropped off. I used my browser's inspector to find the actual dimensions of the image, and no matter what resolution I created my image at, it still appeared pixelated, but only on mobile devices (the main platform where people will view it).In response to my issue with the Dot Thin, they suggested that I was probably trying to tap it incorrectly, and referred me to the introduction video, which I'd already seen and referenced back to when I experienced the issue. They also suggested that I use the Dot Profile's QR code as a backup. I knew that was an option, and I explained that that wasn't my issue; rather my issue was with the product I'd paid money for not working.When I replied with all this information, they didn't answer back with anything about the banner image. They asked me to send them a video of how I was tapping using the Dot Thin. I did so, showing that no matter which way or position I tapped it, it would not work. I also showed that I was following their instructions (phone screen on, tapping in the "sweet spot," etc.).They insisted that, since it was successfully registered to my profile, the product must be fine, and that it was user error, but that I was welcome to return it, or I could exchange it for the bigger Dot Classic. I replied that I wasn't interested in the Dot Classic, but that I'd accept a replacement Dot Thin if they thought that would work properly. They also repeated the same instructions in regard to the pixelated banner image, suggesting the same incorrect image dimensions. I told them that I didn't feel I was being heard in reference to that issue.They basically just sent me the link to return my Dot Thin with the note, "Sorry to see you go."The last time I tried to use the standard Dot Card with someone, THAT didn't work either.Shoddy product (that THEY won't even stand behind), with completely awful customer service and support. I really had high hopes for this product, and now I just have regret for not looking into some of the other options out there first.

Review.Contenu: I am an employee of a nonprofit and this was the best way to go to save on cost.We had an event last week and I lost my dot card. It was easier with the QR code, It takes a while to teach people how to use the dot classic and thin. I can't share my experience with the card because I lost it at the event. But during the event, it was easier to have people scan the QR code. The dot classic and dot thin take time for people to use it. It did take some time to activate my dot. It kept saying the phone number cannot be a linked address.

Review.Titre: I ordered the thin dot because I loved…
Review.Contenu: I ordered the thin dot because I loved the concept unfortunately it seems like it only works on certain phones. So back to my old ways of using a QR Code.

Review.Titre: Good, but it lacks flexibility in the profile setup
Review.Contenu: It lacks flexibility in adding information. A person can have a full-time job and some executive positions in other places, and it is hard to put it there.
I like the idea behind this product, however I am disappointed with the quality of the card and profile design when sharing.

Review.Titre: I like the concept but the thins I…
Review.Contenu: I like the concept but the thins I bought weren’t all that great.I read the refund policy and I won’t be able to get a refund but I will probably just get the cards.

While the QR code works, the touch feature does not in most cases. In all the times I've tried it, only a couple of people have a phone that the NFC tech works. These were iPhones and Android. People don't want to use their camera, they just want a card. I have to switch back to buying business cards.

Review.Titre: Overall I think the concept is great
Review.Contenu: Overall I think the concept is great!  The only complaint is I cannot get the flat circle one to work.  But the card and the raised dot ones to work.  I don’t reAlly know where to put the raised dot on so the only one unisex is the card.

Review.Titre: I didn't receive my dot card yet.
Review.Contenu: I didn't receive my dot card yet. Apparently it take a week to arrive.

Review.Titre: It works great when it works
Review.Contenu: It works great when it works.  I've shown it to 5 people so far it worked great on one.  The other 4 had to use the camera and scan the QR code.  It worked fine then but I think it's a little early in the technology that allows to bump and share.

Review.Titre: I have customers who want a traditional…
Review.Contenu: I have customers who want a traditional card. The ones who are open to it like the concept

Review.Titre: The small dots do not work
Review.Contenu: The small dots do not work, I’ve asked others and theirs do not either. The business card works great.

Review.Titre: My card does not work with Samsung…
Review.Contenu: My card does not work with Samsung Android phones at all. Works great with I Phones only.

Review.Titre: It's hard to share y info with…
Review.Contenu: It's hard to share y info with people..I've done everything rt...I just don't know what to do now

Review.Titre: It only works half the time
I like the ease of having it on my…
Review.Contenu: I like the ease of having it on my wrist, as I used it to network in my motorcycle club, only set back, it fell off my wrist as I was going down the highway. Hopefully the way you secured it gets design better.

Review.Titre: An effective & budget-friendly solution for networking needs
Review.Contenu: As a satisfied owner of both the DOT Business card and the DOT band. These products have seamlessly integrated into my professional routine, serving their purpose exceptionally well.The simplicity of the platform is one of its standout features. While the design might not be the most visually striking, its functionality is unparalleled. The ease with which links can be edited and adjusted is a game-changer for someone like me who relies on quick and efficient networking. It's a basic design, but that simplicity makes it incredibly user-friendly. (My biggest wish would be the ability to upload a graphic for "websites" to help ID by graphic not just title.)Setting up the card was a breeze. The straightforward process ensured a hassle-free experience. The DOT band fits comfortably, and the snap is secure without being cumbersome. If I had to express a personal preference, a slightly thinner design would be ideal, although the current thickness is by no means a significant concern.What truly sets DOT cards apart is their affordability and practicality. I find myself recommending them to colleagues and contacts regularly. The price point is excellent for the functionality you receive, making it a valuable tool for professionals.
I really like the card, however the two halves do not exactly line up.

I am not at all unhappy with my purchase or the product, though it needs a little fine tuning. It doesn’t work with some fairly recent smartphones and I can’t find the how-to guide to help customers (though know I saw one in the set-up walk through). It also says it won’t allow auto-direct when X and Y are the first contact links but won’t let me rearrange said contact links to make it possible. Otherwise, great price and great product.

Review.Titre: Card and Classic are the way to go
Review.Contenu: Ordering process and delivery was top notch! I ordered the card, classic and thin and the only issue I really have is with the thin. Tried it on android and iPhone and it was very sporadic. Card and classic worked every time and will stick with those. Love the profile page and am going to a conference in a few weeks where I will really put it to the test!

Brilliant, easy, professional.  All the way through the process was enjoyable, purchase to setup, to daily use! One lost star:There needs to be a way to differentiate the primary function of the dot card, dot classic, and QR code, individually.  I would like the option to have the card share the contact info and navigate to the dot landing page, but I want the QR code to drive traffic straight to the website.

Review.Titre: Purchase and set up were not difficult
Review.Contenu: Purchase and set up were not difficult.  However when it comes to the ability of others to save the contact perhaps an easier interface?  I know sometimes it is user error, but with both android and Apple it seemed difficult for the user to save the contact information quickly and seamlessly.

Well, I’m not the most tech savvy person on the planet, and I found the initial sign up to be a little bit less than intuitive, and indeed, a feature was turned, either on or off, which made things even more difficult for me. I will say, though that, the person I connected with about that did not tell me to do anything on my own, but actually did it for me so I really appreciate that. They are very responsive.

I really like it, but I'm having a lot of trouble getting other people's phones to recognize it. It's almost never immediate, or the first couple of tries even. I have a clear case that is not thick. I have an android, so I put it up by the camera. So It woudln't keep triggering my browser.

Set up was simple, but a little simplistic.  I have found the dot thin difficult to use.  Original dot and dot card all easily connect with others devices but the thin (positioned on the back of my phone behind my clear phone case) is a bit tempermental.

While a few setup issues were encountered, support did provide good advice. Tap function is not as seamless as the scan QR code option.However a great product and I have recommended to friends and my marketing team.

Review.Titre: This is a handy tool for sharing…
Review.Contenu: This is a handy tool for sharing contact information with business peers and others. It works well, but the instructions for turning the feature on are not completely clear and the card stopped working, until I went in a tried to figure out how to turn on the feature..

Review.Titre: I think consistency is so important....
Review.Contenu: I think consistency is so important at what a person can expect from your product.  At 2 different times, I bought a dot card for 2 different businesses.  The first dot card works as I would expect it to work--both websites and other links (like phone number, email, etc.)  The second dot card only allows me to have my prospects scan the QR Code or tap the card on their mobile phone--it only brings up a website as their connection to my 2nd business.  Super inconsistent!

I like the prompt response and that I was directed to help articles that were already available. I also like how they made me feel they were interested in if the solutions provided actually worked. It ended up being the devices I was using that were causing the issue. As soon as I changed devices the issues of uploading the banner and picture went away.

Excellent customer service and response time. Very thorough answers, super helpful. Like the idea of the product, though I wish I had known the Dot Thin, due to it's smaller area, is more difficult to capture the profile by other phones. I would have opted for the Dot Card instead :( The Dot Thin is super difficult to get a good scan!!!!
Easy to setup. As advertised..needs to add an enhancement to make profile options public or private..otherwise it would be 5 stars
Works great, however the tap feature only works if the other person's phone has NFC settings turned on. Usually easier for them to scan QR code than figuring out how to turn on NFC.

Review.Titre: It was easy to setup my profile and good to know that I can update it at any time.
Review.Contenu: It was easy to setup my profile and order some of your products. The price is right in comparison to purchasing your own stock, printer ink, and getting all the important information included on your business card design.I will have to do more research on how to use the "dot.thin". I put it inside my cell phone case and have yet to get it to work.

Review.Titre: The ordering process was simple and…
Review.Contenu: The ordering process was simple and efficient. My cards arrived quickly, and the follow up emails with videos on how to activate were very helpful. Still, the set up was a little challenging, particularly since I ordered two cards, one for business, and one for personal, and there was no information as to how to set them up using one account.

Review.Titre: The sign up and set up was easy but…
Review.Contenu: The sign up and set up was easy but then I realized I couldn't set up the Thin and the Classic on my phone since it doesn't have payment options. I was able to still activate them with help from a friend but I wish I knew this upfront as many people have older phones too. I would have just got another card or two.

Review.Titre: I ordered custom cards they took awhile…
Review.Contenu: I ordered custom cards they took awhile also I wanted black cards and I was sent grey. The concept of dot technology is outstanding the fact that don’t have to drag a bunch of business cards around and only just one card is awesome.
It's a good product.  You need master accounts and a much better interface for users.

Review.Titre: I like saving paper and I think having…
Review.Contenu: I like saving paper and I think having all my info on the dot card looks great.  I had the hardest time figuring out how to download it and then share it with people.  Can you write instructions or at least give people a website with instructions to go to.  You could put that in the package that comes with the card.

Review.Titre: Overall, a great product/idea needing some enhancements.
Review.Contenu: 1. I really like the card, but it took a minute for me to realize that after the contact is passed on, the receiver has to “Create new contact”. This wasn’t obvious to many. 2. There should be a way to exchange contacts not just sharing my contact information. 3. I have made several referrals that I’m sure have translated to sales. There should be a reward program. 4. Lastly, a couple of my friends got the dot.thin and it’s nowhere near as reliable as the card. This needs to be resolved ASAP!!!!

Electronic business cards are impressive. The actual Dot scanner requires additional steps that make it basically useless, but pulling up my Dot account QR code accomplishes the same thing. Although electronic cards are impressive, people aren't used to them, and they are probably lost easier than keeping physical cards.
Just received my DOT cards and so far I like them. I wish that when people swiped them they could just save me into their contacts instead of having to download though.
It's easy to use and convenient. Instead of carrying a thick pile of cards with me, it's just one. It connects my contacts to all my business platforms and it's great.

Dotcards is great.  Easy to set up profile and activate dot.card and dot.thin.Only negative at this point is with the dot.thin. Sometimes it does not work well on iPhones that have a thick case.  I had to use my dot.card to share my information with a client in that instance.
I have to hold my phone exactly right for this to work. It takes a few attempts but I like it. Apple works better than Android in my experience. I got this because I don’t want to order more cards.
I really enjoy the easy set up but going live is a bit tricky. I also feel that the tap is a bit hard due to the phone not picking it up I have to tap several times to make it work

Review.Titre: great product but has trouble working everytime
Review.Contenu: great product but sometimes doesnt pop up everytime, the QR code is a great feature for when its not popping up.

Review.Titre: Love the cards and how they connect to…
Review.Contenu: Love the cards and how they connect to our website. Wish that they could be seperated when you get the 5 pack so that each of my managers could have their own page to goto. Unfortunately every card is the same one. That is the only draw back.
You guys really tried to get me up and running, I recieved numerous replies almost daily to fix my issues.

Review.Titre: I have used this card mostly at the…
Review.Contenu: I have used this card mostly at the Networking meetings I attend. The one concern I have is the security of the card and my information on the card.

Review.Titre: I recently had an incident where my dot was taken over by someone else
Review.Contenu: The customer service I received during this ordeal was exceptional. What could have been a stressful and frustrating situation turned out to be a smooth and efficient process, thanks to the prompt response from the customer service team.
Thinks it will be great. Just got it so no real input other than I wish it had video capabilities.

Review.Titre: Easy to purchase and set up account
Review.Contenu: Easy to purchase and set up account. Looking forward to making use of the app. I don't enjoy fact that it takes over my screen every time I open my browser.
Dot card is great but hard to navigate. I don't have an iPhone and can't remember the extra steps for iPhone to connect to my dot page.
Affordable, easy to use.It would be great to have a downloadable png or Joey file of the QR code for marketing.
Service and product was stellar, I am sorry that I cannot rate you a 5-5  The reason is simple.  IF I gave you a 5-5 there would be no room for improvement!
I love the product! 5 stars, for sure. I’m a bit older and I would like to have received written instruction, Barney style, for initial setup. However, I’m setup now and I love my dot.

Review.Titre: Only wish there was a customer service number to call
Review.Contenu: I am totally impressed and happy with the product once it gets up and activated but I having no customer service number to call and get immediately help, instead of waiting through email threads back-and-forth over several days for a simple solution that could be discussed over the phone up holds me back from a 5 star rating
I love my card. Though I wish it had more explanation of how it work when you tap it to someone's phone. The company leaves you guessing on that part.

Review.Titre: Great support but the DOT was a little…
Review.Contenu: Great support but the DOT was a little confusing!
The system is good, it doesn't always work as fast as needed but it's good

Review.Titre: It would have been five stars if you…
Review.Contenu: It would have been five stars if you hadn't have used my old last name.  I'm bothered by that. I need to make sure that you have my correct last name.

Review.Titre: Only four stars because it’s great but…
Review.Contenu: Only four stars because it’s great but doesn’t show up on everyone’s phone

Review.Titre: I like the product a lot
Review.Contenu: I like the product a lot.  The expectation of two taps on the other's phone face is not met.
I like em. I have recommended the product to many other entrepreneurs.

Review.Titre: The tapping of the DOT does not work…
Review.Contenu: I reached out to the customer support team and my concerns were addressed immediately.

Review.Titre: Good quality and easy to navigate…
Review.Contenu: Good quality and easy to navigate webside
So far so good. The cards seem to working well. I will give further feedback at a later time.

Review.Titre: I love the product but having trouble…
Review.Contenu: I love the product but having trouble getting the tap function to work.  I have a dot thin.
I think the cards do just as the website states. Just need to teach people how to use qr codes or NFC.
Dot!! I love the card and how easy it was to set up. There could be more colors to choose from and more products.
Y’all helped me get my card set up. Now my card is working. Thank you.

Love my Dot Card.  Works great with the card or sending out my card for people to scan or link to.  Highly recommend to anyone who wants to get their contact info to people quickly and accurately.  Paper cards are always just discarded, however, having my clients put it directly into their phone is a great way to make sure they have my info and can easily be searched by my profession.  Don't wait, get it now and you won't regret it.

Review.Titre: The convenience is well worth the cost
Review.Contenu: The convenience is well worth the cost. I love the fact that I can easily share my business information with people without having to carry lots of business cards with me.
I haven't really had a chance to use it other than with close friends due to health issues but I really do love it and so do my friends

Review.Titre: When you pull out a metal dot card…
Review.Contenu: When you pull out a metal dot card people act surprised because they didn't get a paper card

Review.Titre: Purchasing a generic dot.net card was…
Review.Contenu: Purchasing a generic dot.net card was fast and easy; I’m happy with this purchase and cannot wait to use it!
So easy to order, easier to input all of my information online. What a simple process

Review.Titre: They are easy to set up
Review.Contenu: They are easy to set up, information can be updated and they save resources.
Easy to order,easy to set up, and easy to use. Very convenient. Just tap the persons phone and your information pops up. No cards no waste.

Just purchased the band offering even more convenience. Only issue is improving the clasp, maybe to more like a watch band or some kind of clip. Misplaced mine 2x in the short time I’ve had due to it coming unhooked.. Other than that I’m totally satisfied w dot.card as a whole.. Ty!

I just love how Dot.Cards are taking a spin on business cards and how we can connect with people. Especially potential customers, clients, etc. Great job guys!!! I would not changed anything about you guys.

Review.Titre: This card has made it easy for me to…
Review.Contenu: This card has made it easy for me to network and connect with customers with minimum time loss.

Review.Titre: The bracelet is definitely worth it
Review.Contenu: The bracelet is definitely worth it! Easy to use and much better than fumbling for a business card to hand someone!
Love my Dot card!Easy set up. Great quality. Ordered more than I should have :). It really is a fantastic networking tool.
Cost, product, ease of set-up, and editing, has me very impressed with the dot card.

Review.Titre: Business Cardthe best business card for my type…
Review.Contenu: It's the best business card for my type of business!!

Review.Titre: I bought a dot card that I thought was…amazing
Review.Contenu: I bought a dot card that I thought was awesome but when the bracelet came out it surpassed all my expectations. Very cool, convenient, and easy to share my contact info. People are amazed when I show them. Best money I’ve spent in a long time.

Review.Titre: The overall idea of having a business…
Review.Contenu: The overall idea of having a business card that is downloaded to clients phone immediately is just pure awesome, less cost on business cards & trying to keep with them. And the fact that the person or client you may be sharing your info with doesn’t have to have a dot.card to get your info.

Review.Titre: Timely delivery and the availability to…
Review.Contenu: Timely delivery and the availability to pick different colors within the bundles.
This dot card has come in handy, with just a snap you can give out all your information out , i uber i get asked for my info alot, dotcard has come into play for me its just perfect

I always carry 2 stock DOT CARDS. Now I have Custom w/my logo. Excellent accuracy for data transfer; a super conversation starter in networking events. "The Fortune is in the Follow-up" - Dot Exchange allows that Follow-up!

Review.Titre: Great idea and easy to use
Review.Contenu: Great idea.  I love the flexibility of the card and being able to change information as the business changes. I love that it's eco-friendly and you don't have to carry a bunch of business cards around with you. The Exchange section is great too you can collect customers information as well as giving them yours. The only negative I have is it doesn't seem to always work with the tapping but you can always use the QR code

Next level for networking. I've recently started using my dotcard and it's so easy to tap my info right in to someone's phone. I just left a conference and one of the presenters had their Dotcard QR code embedded in a slide, I quickly abd easily imported her info in the matter of seconds. I can already see how this will nearly eliminate the cost of printing business cards. Highly recommend.

The card is a gift.  The REASON I first zeroed-in on it, was because, the person I want to give it to is a very forward thinking individual.  I always said he was on "the bleeding edge" of technology.  (Which is a step BEYOND "the cutting edge!")So, no constructive feedback, yet.  I'll gift it to him in a few weeks. But, I LOVE the concept!FYI - I dealt with your customer service department.  I got ACTUAL CUSTOMER SERVICE!  OUTSTANDING!  And quite RARE, these days!  Excellent representatives of your company!  (Give 'em all raises!)
A total game changer. I never have to buy business cards again. They are dynamic. As I make changes to my profile they are instantly made to my digital business card. Highly recommend!

Review.Titre: The dot card works exactly as advertised
Review.Contenu: The dot card works exactly as advertised, and it is so much better than traditional business cards! I could not be happier with my dot card!
Very easy onboardWorks great at networking events People see it and it becomes a conversation subject

Review.Titre: Easy to share you information with peers
Review.Contenu: Easy to share your information with others. I run a youth Robotics organization and will be getting my lead kids these as well

The Dot cards are very easy to purchase, set-up and use.  Some phones seem to take quite awhile to connect with it but, using the QR code at that point, helps. I've only had opportunity to use it at one 1-day event so far but will be using it throughout the fall season and hope it has a good response!

Review.Titre: Super glad I went with Dot
Review.Contenu: Super glad I went with Dot! I was looking at all the options for a digital business card and Dot was hands-down the best choice. It's super easy to set-up and use! Everyone started asking me about my dot card!
The fast service and responsiveness when I reached out to your customer support team.  The products work great as well.

This is far beyond a business card. The ability to exchange information so rapidly is amazing! The fact you can also set reminders from an exchange is next level for maintaining contact with potential customers! I don’t know how they can provide such a quality product at such a low cost. Get one now before they figure this out and raise the price!!!

My initial usage was not good. For whatever reason my card did not activated at first. Whenever I would connect with another device it would prompt for me or the new device to login and activate an account. While working with the customer service and IT department we figured out what the issue was and now I find it seamless. It's a great tool and a great CRM asset.

Review.Titre: I love it only one minor “complaint”
Review.Contenu: I love it! It works perfect in place of business cards that will just be thrown away! Plus I can get their information back if they like! My only “complaint” is that if my potential client doesn’t have service they can’t pull it up. Other than that it’s great!

I purchased my Dot Card just before my company's semi-annual convention. It was a great tool to help me share and gather many new contacts. It also helped me look more tech savvy than I actually am. Love it!

I'm just starting my own business and this is a great easy way to start my networking off right. Quick and easy set up. My only recommendation to add is somewhere to help either make appointments or more space to provide info on how best to make one. With a web page based card like this the options are so much greater than just a paper card, don't be afraid to explore them.
Potential clients are impressed  by my network skills; all due to Dot Card. Gone are my days of handing out business cards; only to find them in places I wouldn't have  dreamed I find them

Review.Titre: They answered all my questions with…
Review.Contenu: They answered all my questions with grace and patience.  They actually listen to suggestions which make their way into improvements.  Couldn't be happier with the decision to buy 20 cards for the office.
Great to just carry one business card and so easy to share all my contact info, website and Facebook page.Really profressional looking too.

Remarkable!! I wasn't sure what to expect, as I'm from the generation of a printed card, but love the idea of an ecofriendly card and the ability of not having to carry a bunch with you. The design process was top notch, and the customer service and attention to detail perfect. We had ours customized with our company logo and they are amazing! I highly recommend Dotcards and I know we will continue to purchase more as our company expands.

Absolutly love our dot cards. Such easy integration and use for our employees. They don’t really have the business side down, Although they said they are working on getting that out. Really hope its good

I love this networking card!! It's so much easier & cost efficient than constantly paying for new business cards, especially when you own more than one business & have multiple phone numbers, emails, & social accounts!!

The customer support was very attentive and timely. The dialogue was fluid and thorough until I was satisfied with the outcome. Now the card has been a staple of my CRM and I am very pleased with the results.

I like the idea of a reusable business card and the contact information exchange is a great idea too. The only thing I wish it had is a customizable field I could change each time I share my contact without having to edit the profile.

I ordered the card/dot combo and go figure, USPS lost it on the way.  I needed it that weekend for my work so I contacted Dot and talked with Cindy.  She was awesome!!  She put another order together and shipped it overnight so I could use them that weekend. Not only that, but she later helped me set it up and guided me through things quickly to get it up and running for me that day.  Not a big techie and with her help, it couldn't have went smoother.  Easier than I thought. Just wish everywhere treated their customers like she did!  So far, I love the service and the product!!
I love this card. So easy to give people your business information. 1 card vs 100 business cards. This one card does everything.
I love, DOT virtual business cards! I had occasion to use the customer service recently, and I was takien care of very quickly and professionally. Thank you very much.

Review.Titre: From start to finish it was simple and…
Review.Contenu: From start to finish it was simple and smooth.  No issues took less time than the 10 days waiting for traditional cards.  I tell customer our caron footprint is smaller than before.
Business networking so much better ‼️ It's fast to share your info & exchange also. Great addition to my business

Review.Titre: Very thorough and thoughtful for a…
Review.Contenu: Very thorough and thoughtful for a maiden journey! My friends love it! Im in several musical projects and will try to segregate them for accessing. Might need assistance.

I appreciate having a clean and professional way to exchange information.  I have discovered that it's important to note that the receiving phone needs to be unlocked, and not in an app.  Once that is resolved, it's quick, it's easy, and it's professional.  I love it!

I got the flat dot to put inside my phone case. I figured the longevity would be better if I need to upgrade my phone and would be less likely to be lost versus the card. So far it’s awesome. I’ve tested it on my friend’s phone and it works well. The only drawback is it is a bit pricey VS business cards, but it’s environmentally smarter and can be upgraded info wise so that makes it worth it. Also when you set up your info it’s PRETTY easy to do but one or two things (like adding an extra phone number and name, etc.) are not as intuitive.

How easy it is to carry with me and not worry about damaged card and it is quick and easy for the folks to save my contact information. It gives the others the idea to card this to share with others as well!

Love this card!! It makes giving my info to anyone so easy! It captures my teaching, research, and personal info all in one place. I work in tropical rainforests and having one plastic card to show with a QR code if we are out of signal is perfect! I want more!

Review.Titre: It doesn’t get better than that!
Review.Contenu: I like the freedom of not having to carry several business cards with the dot all I have to do is pass my phone over my client’s phone and all the information is passed. It doesn’t get better than that.

I had a wonderful experience in using this product. It made it easy for me to transfer my information to potential vendors and it also made it easy for me to not having to touch or handle other people‘s cell phones.

I love my dot, but...I could only get it to pop up the link to open on 2 out of 5 phones that I've tapped it on. The QR code is in the back, but I wanted it for the tap feature. So... I'm a little disappointed. *UPDATED EDIT* After my review, the folks from Dot reached out to see if they could help. I was tapping my card on the "sweet spot" on the FRONT of each kind of phone. They helped me out by letting me know I needed to tap on the BACK side of the phone. So, I'm raising my stars to 5. Please re-read my title and first sentence!
The setup is SUPER EASY, it looks clean and professional. The coolness factor is definitely there as you pull out your sleek black card to share your contact info.

It was easy to set up my profile on Dot., which is saying a lot coming from me. I am very new to Dot., so I cannot yet speak to effectiveness, but I like the concept myself and look forward to seeing how well it is received in "the real world."
Easy order. Ok shipping speed. Easy activation. This card has everything except a great way to display it on a table.
This is a great product for the price point.  It was relatively easy to set up.  Makes a great gift for a co-worker or employee (which is why I purchased it).

Review.Titre: Best investment I have made in 2023
Review.Contenu: I was visited by a vendor and I told her i didn't have her contact information in my phone.  She gets out her Dot card and waves it under my phone and now her contact is ready to be saved.  I knew right then I had to get my own card.4 days later I bring my own Dot card to work and the owner is amazed so is our sales team.  They want to ditch the paper cards and move to the Dot card.  This is the best investment I have made in 2023.  Now I know my contact information is in my customers hands so when they need me I'll be in hand.
As a photographer, I am able to share my portfolio and photo day information sheet along with my contact information. I just love my Dot Card!

Review.Titre: I love the concept of it
Review.Contenu: I love the concept of it. As a fishing guide it makes it really easy to connect with my clients. At the end of the outing I just tap over my information and it's all there.My only complaint is, I wish there was an option to use or remove the circle picture. For me it covers up my logo. To busy with both the circle and rectangle at the top of the page.
So far I have been able to set it up and us it fairly well. I do wish I could add my phone number to be visible underneath my name. Otherwise it works as expected.
Dotcards are great. I cannot imagine a better business card replacement and the feedback from my staff members is equally enthusastic. Love it.

Review.Titre: I was unable to connect to my new dot…
Review.Contenu: I was unable to connect to my new dot thin and was getting a bit frustrated. The tech was able to walk me through the setup and get me operational. I'm very pleased with the customer service..

Review.Titre: Got the card quickly but was able to…
Review.Contenu: Got the card quickly but was able to set up my account immediately. Everything was very simple and I am excited to start sharing my contact info with others this way.

Review.Titre: You guys are the best tap card out…
Review.Contenu: You guys are the best tap card out there. I absolutely adore my info page and the color schemes ect. For a single price deal, you absolutely cannot go wrong!
Amazing experience. So easy to set up and shipping was fast. They managed to get me excited about my purchase and even more excited to go network.

Love how my clients find it so easy to have all of my socials so accessible. I've told so many people to get one. They love the simplicity and the way u can customize your profile. Even better- I love that they can save my contact in their phone. I do wish it was one button to save the contact though.. you have to click 3 things to get to save the contact.

Review.Titre: So simple to set up and use
Review.Contenu: So simple to set up and use. My clients love the access it provides and my friends and family love it.I  recommend this to everyone I know

Review.Contenu: So easy and so much more fun than passing a business card that they’re just going to throw away.

Review.Titre: The cards are easy to set up
Review.Contenu: The cards are easy to set up, and the mobile and desktop links look nice and streamline. I love that you can add all of your social media accounts, music, and payapps as well.

Review.Titre: Dot card is one of the best investments…
Review.Contenu: Dot card is one of the best investments I've ever made. I got a black card and I pull it out every chance I get! At the bar, on the golf course, it's perfect for networking in a fast-paced manner. I'm telling everyone I know to buy one.

Review.Titre: It’s easy even for an old guy

You have exceptional customer service and I for one really appreciate that. Thanks for the help and thanks for sending a replacement when I needed it
Customer Service is so on point. I had an issue and made contact with them… my issue was resolved immediately without questions.
Very easy to use. Worked with me when the thin does weren’t working well. The cards are very good and work perfectly. Would definitely recommend the card.
